Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Ease>It means I can finally transport these
goods to Rito Village! Yay! Thanks so
much for your help!<sp:0:4:0>Traysi's always got lots of tasks for me,
so I'd better finish up quickly here and
get back to work at the <clr:0000>library<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>We keep an archive here of old <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>
issues that you can't get your hands
on anymore.
Technically only employees are allowed
to enter, but since you fixed the bridge
into Rito Village, I feel like I owe you.
If you ever want to come here, just let
me know.
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Traysi's always got lots of tasks for me,
so I'd better finish quickly with the
supplies and get back to work.
I don't even want to think about all the
documents I'll have to organize when I 
return to the <clr:0000>library<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>And even though it's daytime in other
corners of the world, the sun is refusing
to show its face, so it's co-o-old.
I might have to throw another <clr:0000>Hylian
pine cone <clr:ffff>on the fire.
Talk_0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Brr, it's co-o-old...especially now that the
sun's gone down. I might have to throw
another <clr:0000>Hylian pine cone <clr:ffff>on the fire.
Talk_0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad>Those things <clr:0000>burn hot<clr:ffff>. Last time I stoked
the fire with one, it caused a gust of wind
that made my bangs all frizzy!
Talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Let me guess.<sp:5:0:0><sp:5:0:0> You have business in
<clr:0000>Rito Village <clr:ffff>as well?

Well, sorry to disappoint you, but the
bridge is down. There's no way across.

Since the newspaper ran an article about
the Rito food shortage, supply shipments
have started to arrive, which is great.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble_01>But with no bridge, there's no way to
transport the goods to the Rito. I'm at my
wits' end here.
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>You!<sp:5:1:0> You put a Hylian pine cone in
the fire!

Didn't you hear me say it makes my
bangs frizzy? Look at this! It's like I have
noodles on my forehead!
Talk_1002_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:Sigh_01>If I was holding an open newspaper or a
piece of fabric, I'd have been carried all
the way to <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>!
Talk_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>You!<sp:5:1:0> You put a Hylian pine cone in the
fire, didn't you? Don't you know that
makes a big gust of wind?
Now my bangs are all frizzy. Look at this!
It's like I have noodles on my forehead!
Talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>And since the sun is refusing to show its
face, it's cooold. I might throw another
<clr:0000>Hylian pine cone<clr:ffff> on the fire.
Talk_1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Sigh_00>What are you doing here, anyway?<sp:5:0:0>
Have you got business in <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>?

Well, sorry to disappoint you, but the
bridge is down. There's no way across.

Since the newspaper ran an article about
the Rito food shortage, supply shipments
have started to arrive, which is great.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble_01>But with no bridge, there's no way to
transport the goods to the Rito. I'm at my
wit's end here.
Talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Ease>It means I can finally transport these
goods to Rito Village! Yay! Thanks so
much for your help!<sp:0:4:0>I'd better work quickly, or else the
supplies will arrive sopping wet. And then
I'm needed back at the <clr:0000>library<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble>With no bridge, there's no way to
transport goods to <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>. I'm at
my wit's end here.
Talk_0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0201><snd:QuestionNormal>Take a guess as to what I'm doing.<sp:0:4:0>That's right!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0900>I'm TRYING to get somewhere DRY.
So, if you don't mind...
Talk_0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Hey, you fixed the bridge! Know what
that means?
Talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_01><clr:0000>Douma <clr:ffff>said she was on the heels of some
gossip so juicy, it would have made the
front page of the <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>.
Then she went out, full of pep, ready to
tackle the story...and I haven't heard a
peep since.
I hope that scatterbrain hasn't gotten
herself in some kind of... <sp:5:1:0>Hm?
Talk_0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Douma is my little sister. We make up
two-thirds of the Lucky Clover sisters.<sp:0:4:0>Recently, she told me she was on the
heels of a story so good, it could have
made the front page of the <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>.
Then she went off to <clr:0000>Goron City <clr:ffff>to
investigate and never came back.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_01>I think she might have mentioned
something about an underground city?
A place called <clr:0000>Gorondia<clr:ffff>?
But I'm worried about her. Goron City
isn't the safest place to be right now,
or so I've heard.
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_00>But it's in Eldin, waaay to the northeast.
What am I supposed to do? Follow her?
I've got documents to sort!
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>You're kidding, right? You've never heard
of the <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>?<sp:0:4:0>It was a smash-hit magazine where we,
the Lucky Clover sisters, shared
tantalizing secrets from all over the world!
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Understand_01>Without the Rumor Mill, there would
have been no Lucky Clover Gazetteâ€”<sp:5:1:0>and
no Lucky Clover sisters.
Some said we were more interested in
gossip than reporting the facts. But in all
juicy rumors, there's a hint of truth.
If you haven't read any of the old issues,
you really ought to.
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM>WAAAH!<sp:5:1:0> What in the name of tittle-tattle
do you think you're doing, standing there
like a statue?
Talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>...You know that non-employees aren't
really allowed in here, right?<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand>Well, since you fixed the bridge, I guess
I'll let it slide.
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>We keep an archive here of old <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>
issues that you can't get your hands
on anymore.
You're welcome to read them, but don't
scatter them around too much, OK?
Talk_0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionAngry>Hey, smart guy. Want to guess what I was
doing just now?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry>That's right! I was SLEEPING! <sp:5:1:0>And having
a pretty nice dream, thank you very much!<sp:0:4:0>Besides, you're not allowed in here!
It's for employees only!<sp:0:4:0><snd:Sigh_01>Then again, I guess I owe you for fixing
the bridge... <sp:5:1:0>OK. You're welcome to poke
around if you like.
On the desk there are old issues of the
<clr:0000>Rumor Mill <clr:ffff>you can read. Just do it
quietly, all right? I'm going back to sleep.
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Douma is my little sister, and the second
oldest of the Lucky Clover sisters.<sp:0:4:0>Recently, she told me she was on the
heels of a story so good, it could have
made the front page of <clr:0000>Rumor Mill<clr:ffff>.
Then she went off to <clr:0000>Goron City <clr:ffff>to
investigate and never came back.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Trouble_01>I think she might have mentioned
something about an underground city?
A place called <clr:0000>Gorondia<clr:ffff>?
<sp:3:0:2:0301>From what I hear, Goron City is safe
again, but I'm still worried about whether
she'll be OK on her own.
Talk_0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, and one more thing. Nothing big.
I just couldn't help but notice...

<sp:3:0:2:0900>You're not WEARING any CLOTHES!


I mean, geez. Aren't you cold, guy?
Put something on before you turn into
an icicle!
Talk_0029:
Recently, that guy Galli tossed one onto
the fire next to some newspapers.

The papers, they got caught up in a
gust of wind and flew all the way to
<clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>That's no way to treat the written word.
Talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionAngry>Hey, smart guy. Want to guess what I was
doing just now?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>That's right! I was SLEEPING! And having
a pretty nice dream, thank you very much!<sp:0:4:0>I'm not very friendly when I haven't
gotten a proper night's sleep. Tends to
make me cranky.
<snd:Sigh>So for both our sakes, why not leave me
alone? If you're bored, you can read old
issues of the <clr:0000>Rumor Mill <clr:ffff>at the desk.
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sigh>You again...<sp:5:1:0> Look, I'm busy. Since <clr:0000>Douma<clr:ffff>
still hasn't come back, I have to shoulder
two sisters' worth of work on my own.
You're welcome to look around, but there
are lots of important documents around
here. Don't get 'em all scattered around.
Those old <clr:0000>Rumor Mill <clr:ffff>issues, for instance?
Since the magazine went out of print,
those are hard to come by.
